intro: Ptilostemon chamaepeuce var. elegans, commonly known as the elegant ptilostemon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its prolonged blooming period, which can last from spring to early autumn.
